subject: RE: [junit] Re: How can I join developping group?
msgSnippet: Dear Alex, I hear that you are frustrated with the speed with which your suggestions are being incorporated into JUnit. As I stated in my message to you dated
messageBody:
Dear Alex,

I hear that you are frustrated with the speed with which your suggestions
are being incorporated into JUnit. As I stated in my message to you dated 20
March 08, we are finishing up the 4.5 release and so are not focusing on new
features.

JUnit has a long history of slow evolution and I expect that to continue. I
consider it a compliment when people can make JUnit much more usable with
minor modifications. If everyone has to make the same modifications, that's
definitely a problem, or if everyone has to modify the core, but our
philosophy has always been to make JUnit an intersection instead of a union
of all useful testing-related functionality.

The next steps I would suggest for you are:
1) Do something to accelerate the 4.5 release, like fill in missing
javadoc.
2) Add automated tests to your feature requests.

Beginning to contribute to an existing project is a little like going to
someone else's home. If you are demanding, if you rearrange all the
furniture, if, in short, you act like you are the most important person in
the room, then you are unlikely to be welcome. If you listen carefully and
offer to help, you have a chance of building a relationship that will help
you feel at home and prepare the way for a closer relationship.

Best regards,

Kent Beck
Three Rivers Institute

_____

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
toalexsmail
Sent: Friday, March 28, 2008 12:03 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Re: How can I join developping group?



It tokes about 3 weeks since I started to figure out how can I
contribute to JUnit project. I eventually wrote to all administrators,
but I have receive no answer from them. If nobody want to discuss my
proposition (and there is no discussion and threads that I opened), so
at least give me write access to CVS and I will do it myself.

--- In junit@yahoogroups. <mailto:junit%40yahoogroups.com> com, Ilja Preuss
<it@...> wrote:
>
> Did you take a look at http://junit.
<http://junit.sourceforge.net/#Developer> sourceforge.net/#Developer ?
>
> toalexsmail wrote:
> > I have some ideas of little improvements of JUnit. See, topics "Filter
> > improvement", "TextListener improvement", "FailedBefore exception",
> > "Parameterized and Theories overlaps", "@Test improvement",
> > "Parameterized improvement", "Failurs, Exception and AssertionError".
> > I want to know:
> >
> > - how decision is make what change should be checked in? Does any
> > submitter can simply submit what he think is good? Does discussion
> > here is enough?
> > - if I have a little code improvements that doesn't affects the
> > contract of the methods can I just make them?
> > - how can I become submitter? What source version control system is
> > used? How can I connect to it? In common, how can I do it?
> >
> >
> >
> >
> > Yahoo! Groups Links
> >
> >
> >
> >
>






[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
